Business¶

Here the modules that implement the application’s business rules will be detailed.

Order¶

business.order.delete_order(index: str, doc_type: str, id: int)¶

Deletes an order.

Parameters

  • index (str) – Index at which the document will be inserted, by default in the index ‘orders’.

  • doc_type (str) – Document type of the inserted document, by default ‘order’.

  • id (str) – Id of the deleted document.

business.order.get_order_by_id(index: str, doc_type: str, id: str)¶

Retrieves a base request based on its id.

Parameters

  • index (str) – Index at which the document will be inserted, by default in the index ‘orders’.

  • doc_type (str) – Document type of the inserted document, by default ‘order’.

  • id (str) – Id of the document consulted.

business.order.insert_order(order_data: dict, index: str, doc_type: str, id: str)¶

Enters a new request, checking that the user entered exists in the microservice user-api.

Parameters

  • order_data (dict) – Order data.

  • index (str) – Index in which the document will be inserted, by default in the ‘orders’ index.

  • doc_type (str) – Document type of the inserted document, by default ‘order’ index.

  • id (str) – Id of the inserted document.

business.order.list_orders(user_id: Optional[str] = None, quantity: int = 10, page: int = 0, index: str = 'orders', doc_type: str = 'order')¶

Lists all requests from the database, whether or not filtering by user. Format the output as standard in the file architecture/er/nosql/order_output.json.

Parameters

  • user_id (str, optional.) – Filter requests based on the user id.

  • quantity (int) – Number of records per page.

  • page (int) – Return page.

  • index (str, optional) – Index at which the document will be inserted, by default in the index ‘orders’.

  • doc_type (str, optional) – Document type of the inserted document, by default ‘order’.

business.order.update_order(order_data: dict, index: str, doc_type: str, id: str)¶

Updates an order.

Parameters

  • order_data (dict) – Order data to be updated.

  • index (str) – Index at which the document will be inserted, by default in the index ‘orders’.

  • doc_type (str) – Document type of the inserted document, by default ‘order’.

  • id (str) – Id of the updated document.
